idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; Esri ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

descript.abstract: World Latitude and Longitude Grid is a polygon theme representing a 1- by 1-degree latitude-longitude grid covering the world with attributes that allow it to display grids at intervals of 1, 5, 10, 15, 20, and 30 degrees. To display a grid with a 1-degree interval, simply display all of the lines. To display a coarser grid (e.g., a 15-degree interval), in the Layer Properties dialog box, add the DEGREE15 attribute value equal to Y.
descript.purpose: World Latitude and Longitude Grids provides latitude and longitude lines for use as an overlay for world-level maps.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, you may contact Esri Support Center by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded.
Outside the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/about-esri/locations.html.
For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

geodetic.horizdn: This data set was mathematically generated. You can define or use it unchanged with data based on any datum.

enttyp.enttypd: The lines represent a 1- by 1-degree latitude–longitude grid for the world.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The degree value and the latitude or longitude directional reference of the grid line.
The indicator whether a grid line is part of the 5 by 5 degree grid.

edom.edomvd: The grid line is part of the 5 by 5 degree grid.
The grid line is not part of the 5 by 5 degree grid.
The grid line is part of the 10 by 10 degree grid.
The grid line is not part of the 10 by 10 degree grid.

attr.attrdef: The indicator whether a grid line is part of the 10 by 10 degree grid.

edom.edomvd: The grid line is part of the 15 by 15 degree grid.
The grid line is not part of the 15 by 15 degree grid.

attr.attrdef: The indicator whether a grid line is part of the 15 by 15 degree grid.

edom.edomvd: The grid line is part of the 20 by 20 degree grid.
The grid line is not part of the 20 by 20 degree grid.

attr.attrdef: The indicator whether a grid line is part of the 20 by 20 degree grid.

edom.edomvd: The grid line is part of the 30 by 30 degree grid.
The grid line is not part of the 30 by 30 degree grid.

attr.attrdef: The indicator whether a grid line is part of the 30 by 30 degree grid.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: Data & Maps is available only as part of Esri® software.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States, contact the Esri Telebusiness staff at 800-447-9778 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/about-esri/locations.html.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Created the 1- by 1-degree grid data set using the ArcInfo Generate tool. Used projection, coordinate, and attribute information from the Esri Data & Maps 10 World Latitude and Longitude Grids data set. Added and coded the attributes VALUE, DEGREE5, DEGREE10, DEGREE15, DEGREE20, and DEGREE30. Converted the data set to SDC. Copied the projection file (.prj), and created the ArcGIS® layer file (.lyr) and spatial indices.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was mathematically generated using the ArcInfo® Generate tool. In this manner, the locations were computed. The positional accuracy is limited only by the resolution of the data set, which is less than a meter.

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify, validate, and if needed repair the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
